### emitRawComment() {#a467ce7d3bd5cb0e5df12b2b7063a4a4d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MCAsmStreamer::emitRawComment (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; T, bool TabPrefix=<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#af6d5cafbdfc5313e65d990120021a3ec">true</a>)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Print T and prefix it with the comment string (normally #) and optionally a tab.

This prints the comment immediately, not at the end of the current line. It is basically a safe version of EmitRawText: since it only prints comments, the object streamer ignores it instead of asserting.

### emitAssignment {#af1d5c7867737745f90d074f16eb1c485}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MCAsmStreamer::emitAssignment (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcsymbol">MCSymbol</a> &#42; Symbol, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcexpr">MCExpr</a> &#42; Value)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Emit an assignment of <code>Value</code> to <code>Symbol</code>.

This corresponds to an assembler statement such as: symbol = value

The assignment generates no code, but has the side effect of binding the value in the current context. For the assembly streamer, this prints the binding into the .s file.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Symbol">- The symbol being assigned to.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Value">- The value for the symbol.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/mcasmstreamer-cpp/#l00196">196</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/mcasmstreamer-cpp">MCAsmStreamer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### emitCodeAlignment {#a5c9184047a9545737b7e35c9607c64df}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MCAsmStreamer::emitCodeAlignment (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> Alignment, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcsubtargetinfo">MCSubtargetInfo</a> &#42; STI, unsigned MaxBytesToEmit=0)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Emit nops until the byte alignment <code>ByteAlignment</code> is reached.

This used to align code where the alignment bytes may be executed. This can emit different bytes for different sizes to optimize execution.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Alignment">- The alignment to reach.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="STI">- The MCSubtargetInfo in operation when padding is emitted.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="MaxBytesToEmit">- The maximum numbers of bytes to emit, or 0. If the alignment cannot be reached in this many bytes, no bytes are emitted.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

### emitValueToAlignment {#acd79313d43de902e2f2f8d2c0189215c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MCAsmStreamer::emitValueToAlignment (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> Alignment, int64&#95;t Value=0, unsigned ValueSize=1, unsigned MaxBytesToEmit=0)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Emit some number of copies of <code>Value</code> until the byte alignment <code>ByteAlignment</code> is reached.

If the number of bytes need to emit for the alignment is not a multiple of <code>ValueSize</code>, then the contents of the emitted fill bytes is undefined.

This used to implement the .align assembler directive.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Alignment">- The alignment to reach.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Value">- The value to use when filling bytes.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="ValueSize">- The size of the integer (in bytes) to emit for <code>Value</code>. This must match a native machine width.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="MaxBytesToEmit">- The maximum numbers of bytes to emit, or 0. If the alignment cannot be reached in this many bytes, no bytes are emitted.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/mcasmstreamer-cpp/#l00282">282</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/mcasmstreamer-cpp">MCAsmStreamer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This is used on platforms, such as Windows on ARM64, that require function or funclet sizes to be emitted in .xdata before the End marker is emitted for the frame.

We cannot use the End marker, as it is not set at the point of emitting .xdata, in order to indicate that the frame is active.

### tryEmitDwarfFileDirective {#aa2807954a9bf3d29ba94545ebaa23584}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Expected&lt; unsigned &gt; MCAsmStreamer::tryEmitDwarfFileDirective (unsigned FileNo, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Directory, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Filename, std::optional&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/md5/md5result">MD5::MD5Result</a> &gt; Checksum=std::nullopt, std::optional&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> &gt; Source=std::nullopt, unsigned CUID=0)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Associate a filename with a specified logical file number.

Also associate a directory, optional checksum, and optional source text with the logical file. This implements the DWARF2 &#39;.file 4 &quot;dir/foo.c&quot;&#39; assembler directive, and the DWARF5 &#39;.file 4 &quot;dir/foo.c&quot; md5 &quot;...&quot; source &quot;...&quot;&#39; assembler directive.
